Thanks for the withdrawal. Don't go spending it all at once!
...No h-hard feelings, okay?

My dapper gadfly, would you care to know how charms are made? I don't often tell my customers, what with the truth being a little morbid. But you're a sharp one so you may have guessed already.<page>Few ways a charm appears but mainly it's from final wish, a dying bug's potent desire crystallised into these gorgeous, powerful trinkets.<page>Now don't go getting too sad. There are exceptions of course, and really, it's quite beautiful, makes them all the more precious. Mmhhmm.<page>Just think of all the little bug souls that went into creating your collection! It's like a crowd of strangers in your pouch, or purse, or...err....wherever it is you keep them.
...Dear dear, I really must hold it together, must appear calm, but this creature... is just divine...
Mmm... What were we talking about? Oh yes, Charms! I can see you've started your own collection. Very nice! I'll show you some of my own, and you can take one home with you if you like!
Ooooooooooooohhhhhhh, you surprised me! Hello, hello! Come in, sweetling! Come in and make yourself at home.

Mmm... What were we talking about? Oh yes, Charms! I'm surprised a stylish little gadfly like yourself isn't wearing any, actually.<page>Charms are gorgeous, mystical, one-of-a-kind accessories with a spark of power woven into their cores. Just wearing one is enough to change your life! You'll do things you never thought possible!<page>Take a look at some of the Charms I have for sale. You can take one home with you if you like!

It's a bit of a sin to wear too many Charms at once, isn't it? Sometimes less is more! Mmmm!<page>Yes, you shouldn't try to cram on more Charms than you can handle. The effect could be positively overwhelming!

Do you wear a lot of Charms at once? It's a lot of fun isn't it, mixing and matching them to get the perfect combination?<page>I don't know whether you've noticed, but some Charms seem to like each other. Yes! Mmm! When Charms like each other, they shine even brighter and sing even more sweetly!<page>Even more reason to try all sorts of fun and surprising combinations of Charms! Mmmmmmm! You'll show me whenever you have a new favourite, right?
My dear. A blessing for you. With your excessive patronage and those startling good looks, you've more than earned it.

Goodness, goodness. You've gone and bought all my lovely charms! What a stunning, colourful collection you've amassed. Mmmmmm! You're even more the attractive bug, clad in all those wonderful, sparkling things.<page>I may have nothing more to give, but you must come back and visit from time to time. Such a dashing figure frequenting my store. I bet the whole village is jealous. Mmm hmm!
I'm Salubra, and this is my cosy little Charm store. Did the townfolk out there tell you to come and visit me? Mmm, yes! This is a lovely little village isn't it? Warm and intimate and full of life.

Ooooooooooooohhhhhhh, you're building up quite the Charm collection, aren't you? Quite the little connoisseur. I'd bet you'd like to wear more Charms at once, hmm? I've got a special item for sale that I think you'll be very, verrrry interested in! Mmm!

Oooohhhh! You flamboyant little gadfly! Your Charm collection has expanded quite a bit, hasn't it? I think it's about time you bought another Notch so you can wear more Charms at once. Go on... spoil yourself! Mmmm!
Oooohhhh! Your charm collection is getting positively enormous! I'm so jealous! I think it's about time you bought another Notch so you can wear more Charms at once. Go on... spoil yourself! Mmmm!
Mmmmmmmmm! Look at you! Every time I see you, you've collected even more Charms! I think it's about time you bought another Notch so you can wear more Charms at once. Go on... spoil yourself! Mmmm!
Mmmmmm yess... I hope my blessing brings you everything you desire! Don't be a stranger sweetums.
It's rare enough that someone enters my store, but even rarer to meet one so striking!<page>Those impressive horns! That fierce weapon. The air of mystery! Ooooh. It's enough to make me swoon.

Ahh my short friend, you've caught me at the perfect time. I'm just about finished charting these noxious caverns.<page>Very territorial types make their homes within this area. I'd suggest avoiding them where possible.<page>Further below some strange thin creatures gave me quite a scare. They seemed an intelligent bunch.<page>In my youth I'd have braved their caves but I fear my matured physique wouldn't be able to outrun them were they to turn violent.

Isn't this a contrast from the Crossroads? Such a humid, lively place. The roads twist and turn in the most wonderful ways.<page>I've done my best to chart the area ahead, though I must admit some of the area's inhabitants proved quite a nuisance.

How are you finding my map? I've tried to fill out as much as I can, but every map is a work in progress.<page>If you'd like to fill out some of the map yourself you can purchase some mapping supplies from my wife up in Dirtmouth. We've set up a little store to help make ends meet.
Come to scale the mountain? I've heard tale of a summit way up there. Too far for me though and I'm not really one for heights.
Y-you want to buy a map after all?

Hello again! Still winding your way through these beautiful highways? Just imagine how they must have looked during the kingdom's height, thick with traffic and bustling with life! I wish I could have seen it.<page>Oh, and I suppose I should ask... are you interested in buying a copy of my map for this area...?

There's a potent odour about these caverns and far worse for me I suspect. My trunk is quite sensitive whereas you don't seem to possess a scent organ of any kind.<page>Is it that you cannot smell at all?

Enjoying the bracing air? We're quite close to Hallownest's borders and those desolate plains that surround it. <page>In this direction, I'm about as far as I'm willing to go, though it's been a pleasant change from the tight confines of the caverns.<page>I've drawn out a small map for the area. It's a simple one and more for completion really. Not knowing the full extents of a region can be quite frustrating.

Ho ho! As odd as much of Hallownest can be, there's a whole new level of strangeness about these caves.<page>Did you see that dark gate below? It's quite unsettling to be near. I did my best to avoid it.<page>Fortunate for me, I found another route in, though I did end up a little singed after wading through some acid.
I jabbed myself on one of those crystals back there. Awful sharp they are and all over the place. You'd best watch yourself if you're heading up.
I'd wager these pipes and chambers were once used to carry the city's waste. Would've been a horrid stench down here. Thankfully that constant rain has flushed them clean.
...To chart the world. What joy... If only Iselda could share the thrill...

Old caverns these ones. Can't you just feel the weight of the kingdom above? It's a heavy thing alright. <page>I reckon not many'd reach these depths. We're pioneers you and I, at least in recent history.

A map can be a useful thing, but it alone won't show you where you are. If you've not the head for directions, I suggest purchasing a compass from my wife, Iselda.<page>She's just now opening our new map shop in Dirtmouth, selling all sorts of useful things to wanderers like yourself. She'll even sell some of my old maps from time to time.<page>I pop back to see her whenever I finish mapping an area. She's always so excited to see me.

This p-place gives me the creeps. Vicious little creatures burst out all o-over the place and the passages are a dark, twisting maze.<page>Unless you're well prepared, I'd urge you to leave, though if you're feeling strong enough to descend, would you like to buy my map?
W-w-what a horrid warren of angry beasts. It's going to take a whole lot of effort to climb out of this dark pit. I think I-I'll hide here a little longer.

There's a large building just below here, out in the middle of a lake and a marvel to observe.<page>I tried to head in, but it's become a nest for those slimey, see-through creatures.<page>Ugh. They're just so... gross, and they give a nasty shock to touch.
Oh, by the way, I haven't introduced myself have I? Yes, I should apologise for that. When you spend a lot of time by yourself, with just your own thoughts, you forget the niceties of conversation.
N-not enough Geo?
N-not interested in the map?

Isn't this a cosy hole? I've been venturing about that wilderness beside here and thought a moment's break was well called for.<page>The landscape's all rather serene this side of the city, though the inhabitants are as ferocious as ever.
We've both come far to reach this grand place. While I'm about these buildings, I must remember to collect a trinket or two for Iselda.

Not interested, then? Yes, quite understandable. Exploring without a map, finding your own way through unknown caverns... All very nourishing for the soul.<page>Perhaps we'll meet again on our travels.

My name is Cornifer, and I've always loved exploring the world. Why, when I was first hatched I wandered off immediately, leaving my brothers and sisters and poor mother behind! <page>That's why as soon as I could I moved to Dirtmouth with my wife. A huge, unending Kingdom to explore right on our doorstep. Who could resist?<page>Anyway, I'll let you return to your travels. With a little luck, we'll meet again. Be safe and farewell!

Hh-hello. I'm Cornifer. I'm a m-mapper by trade. I've tried to chart the dense nest beneath here b-b-but it's proving too dangerous for a bug like me.<page>Vicious little creatures burst out all o-over the place and the passages are a dark, twisting maze. Even with my good head for direction, I-I-I've had enough<page>Unless you're well prepared, I'd urge you to leave, though if you're feeling strong enough to descend, would you like to buy m-my meagre map?

Sorry I missed you! If you're feeling lost, why not pop up to our store in Dirtmouth and purchase a map of this area? Available now for an excellent price!
- Cornifer

Have you heard of Hallownest's Queen? Apparently these gardens were once her retreat.<page>Now some vicious types are crawling all over the place and the plants have grown wild.<page>As inhospitable as it is, I've enjoyed my travels here. Care to see my efforts?
Purchase a map of the area?

I chanced upon a strange bug atop these cliffs. His house isn't far from here. <page>A very imposing figure he was and no doubt lethal with a Nail. I suspect you two might share more in common than him and I.
There's a Stag Station at the heart of these gardens. I would've taken my rest there if someone hadn't gone and locked the door.

I ran into another traveller as I made my way down here. I tried to call out to her as she dashed past but she barely even glanced in my direction. Not an appreciater of maps like you and I, obviously.

Hmm? Ah, hello there. Come down to explore these beautiful old ruins? Don't mind me.<page>I've a fondness for exploring myself. Getting lost and finding your way again is a pleasure like no other. We're exquisitely lucky, you and I.<page>I'm a cartographer by trade, and I'm working on mapping this area right now. Would you like to buy a copy of my work so far?

Ho ho! Aren't these waterways thrilling? A labyrinth of pipes and tunnels.<page>I couldn't have asked for a better place to employ my talents. It's all so orderly, so considered, nothing like the crude irregularity of those caverns.<page>Ahh but so sad, my trunk is telling me those Fungal Wastes are close and I sense my damp adventure may have reached its end. Guess I'll be calling this map done.
Hmm? Have you changed your mind about buying a map?
It's a long trek back to the shop from here. I'll be resting my legs a little longer.<page>Not too long though! It won't do to have Iselda worrying after me.

Isn't this a change from those twisting natural caverns? The rain does cast something of a sadness upon it all but the architecture is simply splendid.<page>Charting such a different space is quite the challenge, though one I've eagerly undertaken.<page>Perhaps you'd care to purchase a copy of my achievements so far?
Judging by this wall, the city's folk seemed hesitant to build further into these caverns. I wonder what kept them at bay?
You don't have enough Geo? Ah, I understand. I'd give you the map as a gift, but I don't think my wife would be very happy if I did. "All our food is made of Geo", as they say.
No Geo... why? Why don't you have enough Geo?
The corpse of a large bug.

Have you seen them? The travellers who set up camp outside of town?<page>I was interested at first, not a lot has been happening lately. But they have a... sinister feeling to them. You can feel it, right?<page>I've told Cornifer he's not to speak to them. His heart and his mind are a little too open sometimes.
Give Fragile Heart charm?
...Mrmm.<page>Very good. The child burns with flame.<page>Master... is waiting for you. Mrmm.

Ahh, that creature beside. It would be naive to claim it friend, though you two share a... similarity? It is a distant link, one words would strain to convey.<page>For it to cling to you now... You've been consumed in the Ritual of that scarlet clan.<page>In what poor moment they descend upon our ruin. Aid their propagation, if you so choose, but do not renege on the larger task this kingdom implores.
Again...? You're so greedy for gifts! Poor little lovely. Give me your Geo, and I will give you your gift.
You wish to see the Master? Return with the child full of flame and he shall appear.
Dance with me, my friend. The crowd awaits. Show them you are worthy of a starring role!
Master... my role.... apart from you... apart from kin. It pains me so.
Go out into the darkness. Harvest the last lingering embers of this Kingdom. Then return to me and we will complete our dance.

The Maiden's Quest
Her Grey Prince diminished and her White Saviour revealed as beast, the Maiden at last understood the truth.Her life's companion would not appear, for they could not appear to a maiden sat idle. She must instead seek them out, must find her love, and free them of their solitude.And thus her own journey began, out into dangerous lands, shielded by her love awaiting, guided by her love to be.With every step, the maiden could feel it, their fated meeting, coming ever closer.
Why must these grotesque strangers intrude on our peaceful little home? Sometimes it feels like the whole world is conspiring to make me uncomfortable.

It is done... and yet...<page>It is not merely by fortune that we meet here, in the darkest, furthest reaches of the world, where my Master's scarlet eyes can not see us.<page>Mrmm. A song that never ends... is no song at all.<page>You take part in the Ritual, yet I sense you truly have no Master. Is it so? Perhaps together we can banish that livid flame and let this dead Kingdom rest in peace.<page>If you wish to silence the endless song... Mrmm, meet me where it began.<page>But if you return to the Master and complete the Ritual... Mrmm. As long as you do it without regret, I will bear you no hatred.
Pay to get a gift?

My dear friend, are you enjoying my music? It's as upbeat a tune as I know, but I must admit, even it falls a little on the sadder side.<page>Please know I play it with joy. Being in this town, beside such good company as yourself, I feel remarkably, refreshingly content.
Just because you're suddenly rich with threaded friends, don't think you're welcome in my mind! Out! Out! Out!
Eeuuarrggh! Why?!<page>Little lovely, don't do nasty things. Don't be cruel. Show it to me! That beautiful thing was made for me... I can smell it!

So you followed me here, to where the Ritual began. You would join me in breaking it then?<page>It is painful to defy the Master, but our harvest... it profanes this dark, quiet Kingdom. This once, I would see the Ritual fail.<page>Mrmm.. Now! Let us destroy the anchor, and banish the Master. Never shall he return here again!
Ahhh! Then the Ritual is complete? And the Master has... moved on? Has he? Perhaps, not?<page>Ahhh, but more for me. Still more I can do. Gifts, so lovely! Aaaahh. Master would understand.
Bravo, my friend. Hear how the crowd adores you! They've not seen such a show in a long time.
Masterful! Even a vessel discarded bears fierce strength.<page>Fine craft dear Wyrm, and perfect tool to prolong the heart of Grimm.
Yes. We are merely vessels for the flame. But... were we always empty?

That young lass! Why, she's up and departed over the cliffs, with only the briefest word of farewell.<page>It's a perilous journey she's set herself upon. I can't understand where she gained such fortitude.<page>I'd thought her a timid sort, one after my own mind... How wrong I was. The call of adventure lures all but me!
That smell! Eeuuarrggh! You're hiding something very nice from me, aren't you? Shouldn't hide something so nice!<page>Show me... show me! Put it on! Quickly!
The one who made my gift... Aahhh, somewhere below? Yes?<page>Very good gift. Very tasty! Delicious!
Eaurgh... Eaaauuurrgggh?!<page>My charm! What did you do to it?! The smell... different. Strange, but nice. Very nice!<page>That smell... talks to me. Someone, somewhere... very nice.

Across these lands my kin now spread, harvesting that essence peculiar to my... breed, the flame in dream.<page>Seek my kin; claim their flame and return it to me. Together, marvels shall be achieved.<page>But don't fret small one. For this task you won't travel alone. My child shall guide you to the flame and gather within itself that burning essence.<page>Like you, the child plays key role in this task. Only with it by your side will the flame, and my kin, reveal themselves to you.
Charm Lost
Endless, repeating songs of sacrifice, of servitude. For the Ritual. For the troupe. For the Master.<page>Even this child was born into invisible chains. Mrmm.

This flower you gave me... when dark thoughts creep into my head I gaze at it and think of you.<page>Why not rest at the bench here for a while? We can enjoy the flower together before you head off again.

That lovely young lass returned to us!<page>I must admit, I'd placed thin odds on her survival.<page>Seems to think very highly of her rescuer, some sort of dashing, warrior type. Barely stopped gushing since she got back.<page>The warrior must have passed down below whilst I was taking my nap. Such a shame. I'd have loved to meet so impressive a bug.

The other residents, they've all disappeared. Headed down that well, one by one, into the caverns below.<page>Used to be there was a great kingdom beneath our town. It's long fell to ruin, yet it still draws folks into its depths.<page>Wealth, glory, enlightenment, that darkness seems to promise all things. I'm sure you too seek your dreams down there.<page>Well watch out. It's a sickly air that fills the place. Creatures turn mad and travellers are robbed of their memories.<page>Perhaps dreams aren't such great things after all...

It must be brimming with them.<page>The city's right at the centre of the kingdom, though I've heard the gates are sealed, so gaining entry can be difficult.<page>It'd be a rich bug that could return with even a fraction of the wealth inside. Despite my age, I've only seen few who've managed it. Must say something of the dangers about its streets.

Again we meet little ghost.<page>I'm normally quite perceptive. You I underestimated, though I've since guessed the truth.<page>You've seen beyond this kingdom's bounds. Yours is resilience born of two voids.<page>It's no surprise then you've managed to reach the heart of this world. In so doing, you shall know the sacrifice that keeps it standing.
If, knowing that truth, you'd still attempt a role in Hallownest's perpetuation, seek the Grave in Ash and the mark it would grant to one like you.
...It faced the void, and ascends unscathed... Could it unite such vast darkness?..

Ghost. I see you've faced the place of your birth, and now drape yourself in the substance of its shadow.<page>Though our strength is born of similar source, that part of you, that crucial emptiness, I do not share.<page>Funny then, that such darkness gives me hope. Within it, I see the chance of change.<page>A difficult journey you would face, but a choice it can create. Prolong our world's stasis or face the heart of its infection.

So you've slain the Beast... and you head towards that fated goal.<page>I'd not have obstructed this happening, but it caused me some pain to knowingly stand idle.<page>...What? You might think me stern but I'm not completely cold.<page>We do not choose our mothers, or the circumstance into which we are born. Despite all the ills of this world, I'm thankful for the life she granted me.<page>It's quite a debt I owed. Only in allowing her to pass, and taking the burden of the future in her stead, can I begin to repay it.

...So strong...<page>You could do it, if you had the will.<page>But could you raise your nail once knowing its tragic conception? And knowing yourself?...<page>Then do it, Ghost of Hallownest! Head onward. Burn that mark upon your shell and claim yourself as King.
You have proven yourself a true hunter, a master of killing, and so with great pleasure I will give you the reward you deserve...

Tiny squib... You approach fearless. Are you a hunter like me?<page>Do you feel the urge inside, to stalk, to kill, to understand?<page>Then take it! My journal. It will aid you. At first the text may seem difficult to discern, but a learned hunter will come to understand its words.<page>Venture the depths of this land and slay its beasts. Prove yourself worthy to bear the mark of Hunter.

So, you've encountered all of the beasts in this land. Impressive! But one task remains, little squib.<page>Keep hunting down creatures until you have deciphered all of my notes! Only then will I recognise you as my fellow Hunter and you shall receive your reward.
Little squib! You may have overcome a few creatures, but you are only just beginning.<page>Don't delay, descend into the belly of this world and hunt down the life you find!
Ah ha! Your journal grows fat and full. Only those last few, rare beasts remain left to stalk.<page>Search the kingdom's corners. Complete the journal. Earn your well deserved reward...
You have my mark, and you shall be recognised as one of my rare caste. Fellow Hunter, I have nothing else to give you.
Ahhh... I knew I'd seen it right. That hunter's quality. Hallownest's creatures fall in your path.<page>Don't stop now little squib, many more there are to find, and stalk, and kill.

Your journal... let me see it!<page>Yes... Yes! The Hunter's journal is complete!<page>You have proven yourself a true hunter, a master of killing, and so with great pleasure I will give you the reward you deserve...

Fellow Hunter. You return? You've already proven yourself to me. I'm only biding time a moment, before next my hunt begins.<page>A true Hunter has no home, no kingdom and I'm eager for new prey.<page>You bear the mark now, but that's only the beginning. That mark will become a part of you, will engrave itself deep within, and that yearning to hunt... It will never leave.
It is stronger even than me... does it know that? Will it return to hunt me...? I hope it tries.

Come to buy a map have you? It's really my husband you should be dealing with, but what a surprise! He's headed down below.<page>He'll pop back occasionally to deliver new maps for the store but I do wish he'd spend a little more time up here. I've not much interest in retail myself.<page>Now, let's see what's here for me to sell.
Are you enjoying yourself down in the ruins? At times my husband makes Hallownest sound a wonder, but sometimes it seems a ghastly, dangerous place.
I'm glad I put down my weapon, this quiet life with Corny makes me a lot happier. It would be nice to stretch my legs again though... sometime soon...
ISELDA_NEW_MAP

Of all the places to end up, we've picked this dreary town. I'd thought it a temporary stop, then my husband became obsessed with that old ruin.<page>Now he's spending all his time down there. He argues cartography is sound business, but other than you, who's buying?

Cornifer's home at last, but look at him, he's exhausted. He always does this, furiously charts a place, then collapses once he's done.<page>He'll be sleeping for some time I imagine, so even with him home, I'm still lost for company.<page>Ahhh, but I do love the bug, even his faults. Seeing his passion for maps, it's something of an inspiration.<page>Corny keeps asking me to join him on his adventures and I've always declined. Maybe next time I should accept the offer?

After more supplies? You've already bought so much. Unfortunately for now, you've cleaned us out of anything worth selling.<page>Cornifer will no doubt be pleased, though I do wonder what he plans to spend all that Geo on.

Corny was telling me of some distinctive graves and shrines about the kingdom. I've made a new pin to represent them.<page>This one was quite challenging to make, and I laboured over the details. It's a nice result so I think it's worth a little more.

Apparently Hallownest has giant metal carriages called trams? Sounds unecessary to me, given those old stag lines that Corny always talks about.<page>Still, I've made a pin to represent a tram station. Might be useful if you're inclined to make your map more detailed.<page>It wasn't too hard to make, so I'm not charging a premium for it.

My husband mentioned some strange roots that grow about the kingdom and suggested I make a pin to mark them.<page>Cornifer thinks my pin's depiction look grander than the sad limp thing he comes across, but I figure, that's not a bad thing. Who'd want to buy a pin of a limp root?
The food I like... it's soft and round and bursts delightfully in your mouth. The smell it emits... just thinking about is getting me excited. It truly is the most sumptuous thing in the world.
Ah, hello again. How have you been faring? Have you come to me because of your regrets? Let me peer into you...

Welcome, small intruder. I've been sound asleep in here for some time...Some, time?<page>Ah. Yes. Yes. Well now you've gone and woken me up. It's no matter, I suppose. I might even be able to help you.
Mmmm... I will enjoy this morsel tremendously. Now, as promised, we will begin the ritual.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain surrounded by pipes and running water. It can not be washed away, though...
I can return your regrets to you, if you share your delicious food with me.
Farewell. I will think of you as I savour my meal.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain in an ancestral mound... a place of strange worships.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain high above us, surrounded by howling winds.

I am Jiji, and if you have found your way into my chamber you must need my help.<page>You see, sometimes we leave our regrets behind in the world, like black stains.<page>If we don't deal with these regrets, hope starts to drain from us.<page>Do you have regrets of your own, little one? Let me peer into you for a moment...
How long I must have slept. This land is so much darker now, so thick with the stains of regret.<page>Even the air is murkier. If I sleep again, will the darkness creep in here and swallow me whole?
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. Only faintly though... a black stain deep below the world, surrounded by darkness. Almost a part of it...
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain just below us, lost amongst the kingdom's twisting roads and highways.

As a service, I can return your regrets to you, so they can be dealt with. You want that, yes?<page>Ah, but I am very hungry. Perhaps you'd be willing to part with a little of your food? Sleep for as long as I have and you build up quite the appetite.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain surrounded by golden light, in a hive far away from here.
Oh? Well, if you have no desire to reconcile with your regrets, I can not help you.
Ah, you seem to have made peace with your regrets in a most novel, and dare I say brutal, fashion. What a joy to behold. Farewell for now. I will think of you as I savour my meal.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain nestled amongst strange fungus and bubbling lakes.
Ah, you don't appear to have any lingering regrets. How lucky for you. You don't need the services of one such as I.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain in the heart of the kingdom's capital. Rain can not wash it away.

Ooohhhh. My masters would be impressed...<page>Rare it is for one to come to terms with their regrets so completely, yet you seem to have managed it.<page>What darkness must one wade through to achieve such a thing?
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain sitting alone in the Queen's Station.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain almost hidden by the glow of shimmering crystals around it.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain nearby, right at the entrance to this kingdom.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain surrounded by warriors and fools.
You seem to be free of regret. You don't need the services of one such as I. Farewell.
Hmm, but you don't have any food on you. At least nothing that interests me. I can't perform on an empty stomach, so please return once you've found something truly tasty... something nourishing.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A black stain hidden away in the darkness below us.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain, barely visible in the tunnels of a nest deep below this kingdom.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain in a lush, green land.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain far way at the very edge of the world.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain in a holy place of repose.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain lost in the fog of a strange land.
Yes, I can see the regrets you've left behind. A dark stain, marring a garden's beauty.
Fat, slow, flying bug. Frequently discharges the acidic liquid stored in its round body.
The light, forgotten.
Ooma
Horrible goo and noxious gas has started leaking down from above. Is there a source of all this pestilence? If so, I haven't seen it.
Crystallised Husk
Small scuttling seed filled with Lifeblood, which can be extracted and consumed for its healthful properties.

"That lowly map-maker's wife? Hah! My Queen, how could you compare yourself to her? In the face of your intoxicating beauty, all other females are merely dust!"
The Grey Prince trembled with anger and indignation... and love.
- 'The Grey Prince' Chapter 178
Uoma
Large and well-protected, but slow and docile. The bugs of Hallownest used to force these creatures to carry around their carts and machines.
These creatures look weak, but sometimes burning pillars of heat will burst out from the crystals they carry on their backs. Be wary, and time your strikes well!
Make their homes all the way up at the top of the world. Do they use the crystals willingly as weapons or are they merely hosts and the crystals parasites?
Shrumal Warrior
Radiance
Mistake
Gorgeous Husk
Plant-like bug swollen with infection. Releases deadly gas when threatened.

The bugs of Hallownest sometimes wondered whether there were other, older, stranger Kingdoms deep below them. What strange fancies they had. That's probably why they were always so distracted and easy to kill.
In the deepest darkness, there are beasts who wear faces stolen from your memories and pluck at the strings in your heart. Know yourself, and stay strong.
Heavyset miner of the Crystal Peak overcome by crystal growth. Can discharge blazing beams of light from its crystalllised limbs.
Bluggsac
Battle Obble
The bugs of Hallownest were obsessed with building things. What strange little minds they had.
Defends the Hive against intruders with its extendable stinger.
Simple-minded creature that haphazardly buzzes around, bumping into things.
Young and playful member of the Grimm Troupe. As part of the Ritual, it gathers scarlet flame within its torch. It will relinquish the flame once defeated.
The spirit of a dead ancestor? The brain of a larger creature, allowed to drift free? An egg searching for a safe place to spawn? I have no idea what this is.
Did the hivelings build their nest around this sorry bug, or did the bug squeeze its body into their nest? Either way, they seem happy enough together.
Nosk
Bests its prey by spitting corrosive liquid. Often hunts in packs.
Guard construct of Hallownest's Palace and skilled wielder of the curved claw-blade. Its heavy white armour protects a fragile body.
Aluba
Great Nailsage Sly
The infection that passes from creature to creature grants strength and courage, but it also seems to enslave the will. Would you make such a bargain?
Mature gruzzer that carries its young in its belly. Attacks by hurling its huge body around.
Lingering dream of a fallen warrior. Protector of the Queen's Gardens.
They say the old King died long ago, but his influence echoes around us still. A creature like that... what did he desire?

"Sagely God of the cunning and bold,
Sharpen Our nails and show Us the odds,
O greatest of masters, We wish to behold,
That one still greater, the God of Gods!"
- Prayer to the Sage

The bugs of Hallownest tried all kinds of tricks and rituals and prayers to rid themselves of the infection. But to no avail! Perhaps the infection came from somewhere deep inside of them that they could not escape.
The bugs of Hallownest lusted after the strangest things in life. They would dig furtively through the dirt for stone, ore and in particular the crystals that grow at the top of the world.
Learned bug that adapted the teachings of the Soul Sanctum into a deadly fighting art. Attacks with bursts of electricity.
Tiny and placid but swells to enormous size when threatened.
Elder Hu
Larger cousin of the Obble. Pairs with a mate for life and will never leave its side.
Deepling
Great Hopper
A shadow that sometimes flits through the caverns, making strange noises to itself. I've never seen it clearly so I have no idea what type of creature it is.
The bright liquid inside of these little fellows is delicious, and drinking it will make you feel stronger. I wonder how my own innards taste... would it be a heinous thing to try and drink some?
Pure Vessel
Warrior fighting for glory in the Colosseum of Fools. Warily approaches opponents with shell held high.
Figment of an obsessed mind. Lacks grace but becomes stronger with every defeat.
Just a child, it drifts about with closed eyes and an open mind. When I was young, my brothers and sisters and I would hunt each other in the nest. Now I hunt alone.
Mossy Vagabond
I have no offspring, nor subjects, nor worshippers. The sum of my being, my learning, my instincts... I leave it all to you. Good luck, Hunter.
More skilled at combat than most bugs of Hallownest, they are nimble but lightly armoured. Keep the pressure on them.
Lingering dream of a fallen warrior. A mysterious life-form that claimed to contain all of the world's knowledge inside of its distended brain.
Hive Soldier
Ferocious but extremely social creature. Becomes aggressive if not able to mingle with its own kind.
Harmless flying creature that favours serene environments. Usually travels in flocks.
Head of the Soul Sanctum. Hoarded soul hoping to stave off Hallownest's affliction, but eventually became intoxicated by its power.
How did this foolish creature lose its legs?! I suppose it's possible to lose anything, if you really try.
Animated remains of a large Hallownest Sentry. One of few in Hallownest strong enough to wield a greatnail.
Having a mate by your side... one that will never leave you until death. Strange. No mate has ever come forth to stay by my side...
A self-proclaimed Knight, of no renown. Wields a nail he carved from shellwood, named 'Life Ender.'
Death Loodle
Royal Retainer
The remains of a bug, consumed by a fungus. Frequently releases clouds of thick, deadly gas.
Slow, hardy creature. The crystals that grow on its back provide extra protection from foes above.
Remains of a bug drawn to the Crystal Peak for its precious crystal. Its claw-pick now doubles as a fierce weapon.
Stalking Devout
Weakest members of the kingdom of Hallownest. Generally looked down upon and forced to do menial labour.
Passive glider that prefers to dwell near acid waters.
Member of an elusive guild of bugs fixated on the maintenance of Hallownest's many signs and wayposts.
Void Idol

Intricate seal of ancient design.

Used to contain a powerful force, or to preserve something of great importance.

They usually drift about peacefully, but sometimes they cluster together and spit out a sharp, crackling flash that will stun and burn even large beasts like myself. Watch closely for an opening and move past them quickly.
Husk Dandy
Kingsmould
Glimback
I don't find this creature particularly noteable or interesting. It should learn to fly, or breathe flames, or sing hauntingly. Anything to justify its existence.
Nightmare King

If you believe in something as hard as you can, with your eyes shut tight... eventually it will come true!
- Marmu
Family of creatures that have learnt to bulk up with moss and live as one.
They only seem dimly aware of their surroundings, making them easy prey to cut your fangs on. What is it that guides them on their paths? It almost seems like they search for ways to die.
Xero
Rolls into a ball and propels itself at intruders who wander into its territory. Aggressive even when newly born.
Winged Sentry of Hallownest equipped with a nail-lance. Charges at threats or throws its lance from a distance.
Fungified Husk
The body of a bug, completely consumed by infection. Spits corrosive liquid.
Youngest of its species. Its body is composed of teeth, wings and stomach.
Flying predator that pursues its prey relentlessly.
Younger hunters delight in catching these creatures and rolling them around for sport. I encourage you to indulge yourself if the fancy strikes you.
Crawlid
Softened by generations of luxury, these bugs lack claws or armour or venom. Those who wish to protect themselves are forced to fashion weapons from stone, ore or shell.
Intelligent being that guards the inner chamber of the Teacher's Archives.
Something queer in the air has caused these mushrooms to grow hearts, minds, and even faces! This means they now fear for their lives, like all other living creatures.
Easily tracked down if you have a sense of smell. I strongly suggest you do not eat its eggs.
Warrior fighting for glory in the Colosseum of Fools. Flies just out of an opponent's reach then darts in for the kill.
This little creeper is weak and poses no threat, but something about it still unsettles me. The way it moves and the noises it makes are... strange somehow.
Watcher Knight
Mantis Traitor
The infection creeping through the Kingdom's dead veins... does it have a mind? Does it produce soul? Is it truly alive?

The plague, the infection, the madness that haunts the corpses of Hallownest... the light that screams out from the eyes of this dead Kingdom. What is the source? I suppose mere mortals like myself will never understand.
Figure from a fondly remembered past. Reacts gallantly to defeat by becoming stronger.
Worm-like creature that prefers damp, dark habitats.
Are these creatures the mothers of the dirtcarvers? They appear only loosely related. But then how do the dirtcarvers get inside of the hatchers? A confusing situation.
Remains of a bug who died amongst the crystals. Animated by a strange force, it attacks by firing beams of light from its crystallised arms.
Aspid Hunter
Oblobble
The infection that swept through Hallownest so long ago... they say that the harder you struggled against it, the more it consumed you.
Belfly
Protector of the Greenpath, trained in the ways of the Nail and the Shell.
I have heard others talk about 'soul' but I do not understand what it actually is. I do know that freshly killed meat tastes best - is that because the 'soul' still clings to it?
Fully grown Vessel, carrying the plague's heart within its body.
Mimics the shape of other creatures to lure prey to its lair.
Sturdy Fool
How does the world look to this creature, gazing out from within its crystal prison? Does it see only light? Is that what drives it into a frenzy?
Deposed Lord of the Mantis tribe. Embraced the infection and turned against his sisters.
Durandoo
Zote
Void Idol

"My love, any creature who could bear to be away from you, who would willingly leave you behind or say unkind things to you... Pah! Lowly maggots, not worthy of standing in your glorious shadow!"
She felt her cold body grow warm, a sensation she had almost forgotten...
- 'The Grey Prince' Chapter 112
Shadow Creeper
Recently birthed, these young aspid instinctively swarm around intruders.
Gruz Mother
Mosskin
Gorb
Swarming predator of the Deepnest. Burrows through the ground and bursts out to surprise prey.

Shamelessly uses its own young as a weapon against its foes! Appalling, yes, but I do admire its resourcefulness. Good hunters do not always make good parents.
I used to think these things were merely ambling plants. When I learned they were actually living creatures, I began to kill them on sight. This is the nature of the Hunt!

Like their smaller kin, their only instinct is to protect the Hive at any cost to themselves. Somewhat clumsy, they'll often damage the structure of the Hive when charging at intruders. Does this cause them shame? I do not know whether they have the capacity for such a thing.
Gruzzer swollen with infection and primed to burst.
Wingmould

May your efforts lead you somewhere worthy.
- Markoth
Rare artifact from a time before Hallownest, its spires twined in a unified form.Contains a large amount of liquid from the Abyss, perfectly still.
What do they hope for, these warriors fighting in the Colosseum? Are they slaves, or prisoners, or do they freely choose to fight?

"A spark of red lights darkest dream,
Scarlet nightmares bright and wild,
Visions dance and flames do speak,
Burn the father, feed the child."

Husk Hive
Mantis Youth
Dances through the air just out of reach until it spots an opening, then swoops in for a decisive strike. If you're confident, wait for it to come to you then counter-attack.
Void Idol
Some hunters train beasts to join them in chasing down prey. I tried it once, but couldn't resist the urge to test my companion's strength against mine.
Hopping Zoteling
Baldur
Maskfly

The Collector

The bugs of old Hallownest did not hunt their own food, they had it brought to them. That's why they were so weak. That's why their kingdom crumbled into dust and faded away!
Former member of Hallownest's high society. Limited offensive ability.
Flukemunga

Markoth
Protects the Hive by hurling its huge body at intruders.

Brothers of the nail, trained in combat by the Great Nailsage.
Wandering Husk

Placid but putrid creature. Holds rancid eggs within its gut.
Uses its small, sharp claws to climb along walls and rooves.
These fools meddled with the soul of other creatures and lost their shape. Now they skulk through the shadows of their Sanctum like slugs, hoping their old brothers will build them new bodies.
This odd creature is unaffected by and unaware of the disease drifting through the caverns. Its madness is all its own.
Loodle equipped with a helmet and taught to kill.
This fierce little hunter will bravely chase down creatures many times its size. Admirable! It is weak though, and I have devoured hundreds of them with little effort or care.
The gas that seeps from their growths smells invitingly sweet, but it will burn through shell and flesh if you get too close!
Huge fungal creature. Attacks by spitting corrosive venom and slamming its body into foes.
Grimm
I have seen this nimble little creature. I thought her prey and pounced at her, but with a flash she stabbed me with her flying stinger and darted away. Could she be... a Hunter?

Weak, but hard-working and numerous. Their hairy little bodies are filled with a thick, sweet, golden liquid. Good to keep a few on you for long hunts.

Ghastly, eerie creature made out of thick liquid. You can peer right through them, and can't see where they keep their thoughts. I don't trust them at all. Keep away.

Powerful and devoted member of the Grimm Troupe. As part of the Ritual, it gathers scarlet flame within its torch. It will relinquish the flame once defeated.

The remains of a bug, animated by a strange force. Wields a nail and shell.

Simple, weak creatures find strength by forming a hive and obeying a ruler. Such creatures become the arms and teeth and claws of their monarch.

If you're skillful, you can lead their spores back to them and watch them perish in a destruction of their own making. There is a lesson in that, I think.
Timid creature that frightens away intruders by covering itself in huge clumps of moss.

The spines they fire seem to be mildly poisonous. Don't use them to clean between your fangs after eating!

Leaps around the edge of the world, trying to crush prey beneath its body.

...A problem. It did not bring the gift Jinn wants. No trade can occur... None.<page>...Will It seek out the gift Jinn wants? The horrible... round... disgusting gift? Will It return? Jinn will be waiting...

... how much longer... KILL IT... how much longer... DANGEROUS... how much longer... KILL IT... how much longer... KILL THE EMPTY ONE...<page>...how much longer... must I dig...?

My King... Hallownest will be reborn! Glorious and bright! Just as it always was...

Heroic...Beautiful...

My dear. Aren't you so kind, checking again on my well-being. I'm ever the caring host. I can't understand why more don't visit in your manner.<page>Now you won't mind while I take just a little bite... Just a leg perhaps? A full belly is the best path to happiness...

I can almost smell it! Ha ha ha!
...Another horrible... disgusting gift. Jinn will keep gift for... Friend of Jinn... and It shall have shinies. That is trade...

You've placed your mark, and the great gate has opened. Go on! Step into the Colosseum and cut your way to victory.
So peaceful. So dull.

Dear Ogrim, I'm sure you saw Dryya on the way in? She's stood guard over me for so long.<page>Despite her hard front, she's always been a caring type. I'm sure she'll much enjoy a Knights' reunion.
Prepare well, but don't dally. Were the Vessel to break prematurely, that plague would unleash with rage and power built of ages chained.

...Wyrms pull bugs into their thrall,
Till ages pass and kingdoms fall,Caps and shells may fall to dust,

Ohh, bury the knight with her broken nail,
bury the lady, lovely and pale!

then bury the beggar with his shining croooown!

Oooohhh radiant being, we are blessed. Your rays touch us. Your warmth fills us.<page>Hallownest is born again, united in your blazing image. Oohhh...
Go now, mighty warrior of Hallownest! You've proven your honour! Good fortune on the path ahead.

Ahh, you're awake, and looking well-rested!<page>I was startled when I woke to find you curled up beside me, but of course you're welcome to rest here whenever the world wearies you.<page>As the King granted his kingdom, to shelter to those who needed it, I offer my home. Stay as long as you like, down here where it's cosy and warm and moist.
You shall seal the blinding light that plagues their dreams.<page>You are the Vessel.<page>You are the Hollow Knight.

The White Saviour Returns
Long had they remained apart and the village, once so warm, now grew cold. The maiden felt the well of grief. It gripped fierce about her lonely shell.And suddenly, as though her tragic state was sensed, the saviour returned, standing tall, glowing bright. Below shining horns, eyes welled black, glistening, eyes only for the maiden long missed, long desired.Her saviour leaned close, sat beside, perfectly composed. In that charged, breathless moment not a word needed be spoken, The maiden's shell felt suddenly tight. Her claws curled. No glance was shared, no claws touched, just perfect, aching love shared in silence, together...

...Oh. Excuse me.
