Eeeauuggh! You broke it! I gave you that charm as a gift, and you broke it! Clumsy little fool... Nasty.<page>Apologise, ask me nicely, and I'll fix it for you. Give me Geo and I'll fix it for you.
Where will the line of Hallownest's Great Knights end? With me? Can such a thing be passed on?
Are you curious? You're wondering... how I make my special gifts.<page>Eeeauuggh! Don't try to steal my secrets! I'll steal them right back.<page>If you're cruel to me... you'll be sorry.
Hmm. The air has changed, I can smell something new. Dangerous things are drifting through here now... are you scared?<page>If you stay here... I won't protect you.
Light is life, beaming, pure, brilliant. To stifle that light is to suppress nature.<page>Nature suppressed distorts, plagues us. Embrace light! Achieve union! Oohh..Ahhh.
I'm taking what brief rest I can, then I'm off in search of less terrifying challenge. This nest is no place to die.
...A King, the tiny It becomes. Jinn knows that mark, but cannot bow.<page>Jinn's masters are other... minds other... Not order. Not order, they seek.
...So there were others...
...Soul of Wyrm. Soul of Root. Heart of Void...
Mngh? If you don't want it, I'll keep it.
You are the Vessel.
Woulds't you perhaps attempt the journey to che's lover's grave again?
Ha ha ha! Are you suh... surprised? I remembered the second verse! Lots of time to think while I work down here. Maybe I can even c-come up with some songs of my own!
This whole area swarms with deadly critters, biting, burning, scratching types. I'd thought to test my strength against them. Now that bravado has left me and all I feel is tired and sore.
I look forward to our next contact, tiny saviour. Then you'll meet a warrior with courage to match your own.
...It refuses to trade...? It has a will... all Its own. Can refuse. Jinn will keep waiting... until a gift comes.
Why don't you have enough Geo?!<page>Mnnghh! I won't share my food if you can't give me Geo.
Me'hon? Does the heart beat a moment? Share pain of grief and hope to soothe it?<page>Would you convey che's final gift unto her lover's grave?
Faces I grant to all who'd request. Not task for I, but aid, gift to a world deserving.
Isn't life just wonderful...

Ahh! So it bears our once-fractured soul, now complete. Such strength, such resolve, such dedication! Is it more than simply a Vessel? I almost feel like I'm once again in the presence of my beloved Wyrm.<page>The Kingsoul... What is at the heart of it I wonder? If its curiosity wills it, it should seek out that place. That place where it was born, where it died, where it began...
A pauper... not enough Geo.<page>Leave now. Return with more Geo.
Mumushi ola, mumushi u nungoo. Myusha? Dungo myusha? Gungi, gungi...

Ha ha ha, do you know that one? It's one of my f-favourites! We can sing something else if you like. You start singing and I'll join in. I bet you have a b-b-beautiful singing voice! Ha ha ha!<page>So, what are you down here for? If you came to g-get wealthy, just look around you! These mines are still bursting with riches! There's p-p-plenty for everyone, just grab a pick and join in! Ha ha!

...That scent. Does another travel with you? Is that you Ogrim, my mighty Knight?<page>I cannot see you, but then time has clouded my eyes and I cannot see much. Even your booming voice falls silent upon me.<page>Only this small one I register, if maybe because it shares some piece of myself. This one stands clear upon a misted world.<page>Ah.... But my my, that potent smell does recall such joyous memory. Only a short moment we had together, compared to ruin now endured, but what shining times they were.<page>I am grateful you would visit, even if to see me in somewhat faded form.
No doubt this one will meet its demise at the nails of the city's guards. I'll outlive you too little grub, as I did all the others.

Oh. Please. Please. Don't be shy. There are some nasties about here alright. Not me. I'm a friend to all and happy to serve a traveller so bold as you.<page>Is it information you seek? That I can provide. Yes. Oh yes. Heehee.<page>That village above here, home to a sad creature. Hers is a tale of tragic exchange. Cost her and her people greatly, though I suspect she bore no regret in making it. <page>Heehee, yes. I know. I know. You're intrigued. You want to know the tale. Well I'm sorry. I'd love to tell it, but I'm just, I'm very, very sorry, and I haven't eaten in some time...<page>And oh, I'm STAA-AARVING...
...Isma... So strong.... Teach me...

Ah! Tiny warrior. I'm glad I could see you again. You've inspired me! I'm about to head off in search of other places and other foes.<page>This quiet town's the perfect stop before I scale the cliffs and head out onto the plains.
So it can access a mind? Then the seals shall break before its blade.
You're welcome to join me, there's enough for both of us! Or if you don't feel like d-d-d-digging, you can just sit and sing with me! Ha ha ha!

Ulll Waaaaii! Che's sacred, precious, one of its kind flower. Ruined. Che's love, denied her final gift. Such suffering for che'. Such misery. Che' thought she could bear no more.<page>...I suppose, che' does have one more flower though.<page>But Le'mer! This one is equally sacred and equally fragile. Where'st one to accept such quest, it must become mel'precious heart. Would such a thing be again be tried?
You turn away? Che' should've expected such. This world is not one of favours. Only of heart-ache.
Such bad luck. The critters about here are just terrifying. Those scuttling legs, those gnashing teeth.<page>Tis not the end I'd ever want to meet.
Will you place your mark and attempt a trial?

Ahh! That tear... You've been to her grove!<page>I swore I'd visit, but... my duties... my oath...<page>Oh, I'm sorry. Ignore me, I'm being foolish. If I'm not careful I'll sink down into old memories and won't ever come back again.<page>She's a great judge of character, so if she gave you her blessing you must be something special indeed. I'm barely worthy to be in your presence!
Welcome back, warrior!
Make a contribution, and you can enter the Trial of the Warrior.

...Well if things are getting too dangerous down there, maybe it's time to take a break?<page>Come back up and spend some time hunting, or gathering, or wandering aimlessly.<page>No, not too much longer now...
Make a contribution, and you can enter the Trial of the Fool.
Make a contribution, and you can enter the Trial of the Conqueror.
Enough talking! Your jabbering... annoying. Step over here and show me your Geo.

...Bury... body... cover... shell,
Darkness. No meaning... DANGEROUS... Still, remain...
LIGHT.... again...
...Another? Does It offer gift to Jinn...?
How funny that I see you in my dreams too, little one. Your noble bearing reminds me of our dear King. When he returns, I'll ask him if you can become a Knight! What jolly adventures we will have...

Ahhh tiny warrior. Then, you too come to test yourself against that traitorous tribe?<page>A deadly bunch they are that roost within these glades. I'd once've stayed well clear of them, but your actions have shown me the truth of it. We must face down our fears or be defeated by them.<page>If we both make it through, we can swap stories of our adventures. I'd look forward to that!

Eeeauuggh! That smell you carry with you...<page>Ah! Ah! Ahhhhh!<page>...Very tasty!<page>You're sweet... to share such a tasty smell with me. Do you want a gift in return?<page>Cheaper... Yes. My beautiful gifts... I'll give them to you. Cheaper.
My King... We will all be together once more...
...The perfect challenge. I can already taste my victory...

This place must once have been quite the hub, built at the border between two lands, that misty drop to one side and those bulbous growths another. <page>Neither place seems particularly welcoming so while my little treats last, I think I'll stay right here.

...Bury my body... c-cover my shell,
What meaning in darkness? Yet here I remain...
I'll wait here forever...till light blooms again...

The White Saviour
The maiden woke in darkness. Confused she reached out. Sharp brambles jabbed at all sides. Burning acid bubbled close below. What nightmare had led her here? What hope of survival remained?Doomed she thought herself and to despair she fell, until a light bloomed far in the distance, a bright, glowing spot fast approaching. It swept majestic about the thorns, leapt above burning waters and dove towards the maiden.Coming close, the form revealed at last, a beautiful being, sharp horns gleaming white. Arms reached out for the damsel, gathering her up, grip firm...
You've changed your mind, haven't you? Give me Geo, and you can see something... nice.
This little squib clearly fears me. I'd kill it right here, but it'd be too pitiful an end.

For quiet retreat did I climb up here, away from spitting creatures. Ormmph... Yes. High up. Away from simple minds, lost to light.<page>Theirs is a different kind of unity. Rejection of the Wyrm's attempt at order.<page>I resist the light's allure. Union it may offer, but also a mind bereft of thought... To instinct alone a bug is reduced...Hrrm...
Born of God and Void.

Within my roots, the weakening of the Vessel I plainly feel. Only two obvious outcomes there are from such a thing.<page>The first is inevitable on current course, regression, all minds relinquished to that pernicious plague.<page>The second I find preferable, and would seek your aid in its occurance, replacement.<page>I implore you, usurp the Vessel. Its supposed strength was ill-judged. It was tarnished by an idea instilled. But you. You are free of such blemishes. You could contain that thing inside.

Oh... hmm... Could it be? You've returned at last? No. No... <page>Oh pardon me! For just a moment, I mistook a certain quality about you. You seemed almost... regal. <page>Silly, I know. It's clear you're not of high birth, wandering about all dirty and tattered like that.

Oh, it's you again. I'm glad to see you return.<page>No, no, please... Don't say a word. I must apologise for my previous behaviour.<page>Entirely my fault. I mistook you for one of those mindless skulking husks, yet you bested me in the most majestic knightly fashion.

We knights defend against the physical, but a formless enemy. How to defeat such a foe?<page>Our King tried in his own way. A cruel means it was... And still, eventually, we were brought low.<page>Bah! I shouldn't be so morose. You've invigorated me. Tis' truly a delight to meet one whose strength can match my own.

Such joyful, vigorous combat. I'd almost forgotten the feeling.<page>I was once a Knight you see. By the grace of our good King, I stood proudly before the throne, watching Hallownest swell to greatness.<page>Then that nasty business with the affliction...
Ohhhmmmm... Tiny thing... It evolves beyond that Wyrm. Such union in a single being. A strength before unseen. Would it too challenge nature? It could perhaps defeat it.

I'll offer fair warning. The Vessel may itself be weak, but it is much empowered by that force within.<page>To claim its role requires strength of some magnitude. Prepare yourself well before attempting the task.
...Will It seek out the gift Jinn wants? The horrible... round... disgusting gift? Will It return? Jinn will be waiting...
Placed flower
For this kingdom's faceless, I shall provide.
Lord Fool, give me another chance. I'll prove my strength to you!

The Grey Prince
Heaving heavy breaths; flush from the exertion of battle; the figure emerged from the well. Triumph was his and trophy he bore to prove it, the fearsome skull of his vanquished opponent.Startling warning he brought to the village, one that rung so true: Their white saviour, thought a hero by the bugs, was a vicious beast and this shrouded grey prince was in truth the hero deserved.With honour and humility he recounted his quest below, his epic journey of one purpose, to find her, to protect her, his grey maiden, his partner in darkness...
Feel free to stop by anytime. Though I do like the quiet in this station, a little company is always good for one's health.

Oh! One arrives. Far it walks to find me. Did it seek my aid? Or did the path carry it by chance to so pertinant a place?<page>It is true. True, that you were awaited. No. Perhaps that is inaccurate. True one like you was awaited.<page>I have a gift, held long for one of your kind. Half of a whole. When united, great power is granted, and on the path ahead, great power it will need.
I'll share my food with you... if you give me Geo.

Ohhh, bury my mother, pale and slight,
bury my father with his eyes shut tight!
Bury my sisters two by two,
and then when you're done, let's bury me toooo!
We will all meet again. I promise it...
My friends... I will protect our dear Kingdom. Have faith in me!
You're a fool, aren't you?

The White Saviour in Darkness
Troubled dreams beset the maiden. Her saviour gone, consumed below. Now her only companion the cold wind, moaning at her door. Her heart fluttered with sudden fear...Then still. A sudden calm. Why? A presence. A figure close behind.She doesn't dare look, doesn't dare move, fearful the slightest action would break the spell. She knew the presence at her bed, knew the calm only they could bring.Her white saviour, now protector, standing tall beside, powerful, perfect...
Here sleeps the Traitors' child.
To enter a trial, step over to the board and place your mark. From that point on, your destiny is your own...
It likes Jinn's shinies? Jinn has many... many. Gifts, from another, helped by Jinn. Hurt by Jinn.<page>Jinn did not want shinies. Only clutter. Mess. But can trade, for gift.
I wasn't hiding, you know. Just napping before I head off again.<page>Bound to be facing even more deadly beasts soon, so I gotta keep me strength up.

...Is It... here, waking Jinn?..<page>Observed... Small. Dull. No Soul. Long shadow... It is blank, but brave...<page>Does it bring offering?<page>Jinn, has only many small, shiny things... useless to Jinn, but will trade for wonderful gift.
...Does it know of the face that hides beneath? Such remarkable contrast the Wyrm conceived....

You placed your mark and left! What cowardice! Maybe you don't have what it takes?<page>A true warrior strides unstopping into battle. They gain strength by vanquishing others, not in flight from them.

Ohhh, bury the knight with her broken nail,
bury the... p-priest... something about a crown...?
I c-can't remember the rest of that one, ha ha ha! Maybe I'll just hum it.
Until our paths cross again...
Be on my way soon. Nola is waiting and I'm done down here. Just savouring the moment a little longer.

Then this new, sacred, one of its kind flower che' shall give you. As che warned before, it doest become precious as one's heart whilst held.<page>If you were to get hurt again whilst carrying it, or did to attempt ride those jolting transit beasts, this one too shall be destroyed.<page>Though my faith in one has been...challenged, my hopes are still with you Le'mer.
Has it witnessed that truth most tragic? The Wyrm's great shame sealed away.<page>Now this Kingdom's stasis becomes the Wyrm's legacy.
Th... thank you.

Sorry, when I look at your face I can hardly... I just can't believe you came all the way down here to rescue me. I didn't think anybody...<page>Sorry... I mean, thank you. I mean... I'd better go. Back to town I mean. I'd better get home...
Ohhh... please... don't leave me behind!<page>You... forgot about me...? I knew you would... everyone always forgets about me...
I-I'm sorry. I got lost, I don't know how I ended up here.<page>I... you came here to rescue me, Bretta? The girl that everyone just... ignores?
Oh?! Who are you?<page>Your face... you're so... so...
...It's not by tools that you'll triumph, it's through your smarts, your speed, your determination....

...I haven't seen her, no. I'm sure you'll remember where you left her eventually.<page>Trust the moon, or yourself. Or trust her. You need to trust something, that's my point.<page>Hmm? No, not him. No. Absolutely not.
Let me show you then... take a look. Do you want them? If you really, really want them, I'll trade them... for more Geo. More Geo.
This falling ash is moult. The Wyrm's corpse decaying. Endless. Rmm... Serene. Sad.<page>With its like gone, the world is smaller.

...The dead can't make use of wealth in any case. What would they spend it on?<page>Yes, a big brood like that. They need food. And shelter. And toys.<page>If you keep some for yourself... Well, I think you deserve it. Yes...
...Shouldn't trust the eye they gave you. Rely on your own instincts.<page>If you've got a keen nose, use it.<page>And while you're hunting for secrets, beware those who are hunting you!

...It's nice that you were able to help your friend. So you're not hungry any more?<page>Yes, that was quite the appetite. I was impressed. Still, we all move on sooner or later.<page>To greater things, perhaps? So much can be achieved in just a short time...

Do I seem prisoner here? If so, it's not by any choice but my own. These bindings about me, I've chosen to erect.<page>There is some shame I feel from my own part in the deed and this method guarantees it cease.<page>I still feel that urge you see. I always will. A voracious desire to spread seeds upon the land, to propogate myself, to breed.
Is it that, Le'mer? Such grief, can end? Che' can end?<page>Ullll, eh nai dear love. Che' too can end.
Is it you bothering about my tail? Rest is somewhat disturbed, but I find that sensation not unpleasant..Ohr..Ohr...Ohrmm.

Ah ha! The tiny steps of a tiny creature. You got the look of an adventurer, so we've much in common.<page>Searching for dangerous places aye? Well you're on the right track.<page>A long necked critter warned me of a tribe deeper down. Warrior sorts, so she says and I'm itching for some serious combat.
Mmmf, delicious.
Mmmnnnnnnngghhh... Don't take something if it isn't yours. That's the law.<page>Everything you see... it belongs to me.<page>Don't be angry. I'll share my food with you... if you give me Geo.
Her grave lies in the middle of the Queen's old retreat. It's a far journey from here and you've already learned how dangerous those paths can be.<page>Be safe...And be more careful. Me'hon.
...Blinding...Rising...Never be empty...
Leave me be. It's the arena I seek. I've already wasted far too long on these cursed roads.
Stay alive my friend. Whatever you seek in here, I'm sure that tribe won't look lightly on our intrusion.

Oh! Ahh. Such a tiny creature, yet you dealt with all of those beasts?<page>I wasn't hiding, if that's what you're thinking. Just waiting for the right moment to pounce!...No... I can't speak such a lie... I was hiding.<page>Those ghastly things chased me and I ran. If you hadn't come along, who knows if I'd ever have survived.<page>Others take me for a fearsome warrior, what with my impressive size, but this kingdom's beasts, I wonder if I'm just no match for them?...<page>...
This little creature looks tasty. I wonder, should I eat it? The others around here were awfully bland.
You won't make a contribution? No one ever won glory by clinging to their Geo...

Le'mer, takes that heavy mantle...Che' wouldn't wish it upon one. Having served that brand at its great height, che' knows well what suffering it brings. Enough to turn nym'King to flee or fair Knights to mourning.
A mask! A face! Does it need one? Does it not? To define. To focus. To exist.

Aha! Another warrior finds their way to our fair Colosseum. Ours is the final destination for all seeking trials of intense and deadly combat.<page>All one has to do is place their mark upon their Trial Board of choice and lo! The arena's gate will open.<page>There's a small fee attached to each trial, but I'm sure as skilled a combatant as yourself will have accrued a wealth of Geo.<page>Now, before you draw your nail and rush eagerly to battle, I'll offer one quick word of advice.<page>There's a warriors' pit just below here, where others like yourself await their own trials. I'd strongly advise using it to rest up before placing your mark.<page>Oh and have no doubt, I'm a fearsome warrior myself. Don't go judging me by my size, or my current... errr... constraint. The Colosseum beckons us both! I'll be back in battle soon.
A wonderful thing to have, a face. Not a thing with which we all are blessed.

Mi'? Le'mer, you have done this thing? Is it possible? This world's cruelty, I'd thought it overwhelming, but le'mer, such great compassion. That Che's love would know her partner's heart even aeon past.

...Does It want to know of Jinn?...<page>Jinn, little know... cannot tell of self. Too young, its thought, its mind. Born to provide, to trade.<page>Will help, to trade, yes?... Bring Jinn gift. Wonderful gift.

The Grey Prince
Heaving heavy breaths, flush from the exertion of battle, the figure emerged from the well. Triumph was his and trophy he bore to prove it, the fearsome skull of his vanquished opponent.Startling warning he brought to the village, one that rung so true: the white saviour, thought a hero by the bugs, was a vicious beast and this shrouded grey prince was in truth the hero deserved.With honour and humility he recounted his quest below, his epic journey of one purpose, to find her, to protect her, his grey maiden, his partner in darkness...
I could only hide. What warrior am I?..
Gungi, gungi... Mishi umo sanga. Poggi u dungo?
Is it mask or face upon the creature? In Hallownest, a difficult thing it can be to decipher.
You think this shell a defensive arm? Well I'll give you fair warning, it conceals a deadly surprise. Pray you never find out what that is.

Building these models takes patience and a light touch. It's worth it though, seeing the grand old Knights of Hallownest come to life before our eyes.<page>Mighty Hegemol was always my favourite. What a towering figure he was, though surprisingly soft spoken for one so large.<page>They were all impressive in their own right, of course. Fierce Dryya, kindly Isma, mysterious Ze'mer... erm, and the other one.

That charm! Only the Great Nailsage could have given that to you...<page>Seeing how strong you've become... it almost makes me want to take up my nail once more.<page>But no, I should stay on my current path and keep working at my art. If the Great Nailsage ever comes by, I want to show him how far I've come.
You've returned, though you were not invited. <page>As my pupil, it is lawful that I allow you rest and shelter, but do not stay longer than you need to.
"Those who do not share their strength will never learn." My master used to say that.<page>Substitute "Geo" for "strength" and you'll have my own views on the matter. Begone!

That charm...! Could it be?! Only the Great Nailsage himself could have bestowed such a thing!<page>Your achievements humble my own, my pupil. I myself have sworn never to lay eyes on the Nailsage again. Not until I have truly mastered his teachings.<page>But if you see him again, please... let him know that I am forever grateful.
So, your travels have brought you back. What have you learnt? How have you grown?<page>Myself? I am still trying to capture something with my brush... although I'm not quite sure what that thing is.
I have spare brushes and plenty of paint. Once you tire of the nail, feel free to join me in my art.

My pupil, why do you hesitate? Do you think yourself unworthy of my Nail Art?<page>Do not fret. I too was once like you, unsure of my own strength. Stay here with me and meditate, and once you are ready we can begin the lesson.
Rest here if you must, but do not stay longer than you need to.
Before you leave, rest and meditate with me for a while. Your company is always welcome.
I have taught you all I can. Go back into the world, traveller. Leave me to my solitude.

Hmph. I must say, you are an excellent pupil.<page>Your skill with the nail, and your thirst to become stronger... you remind me of my brothers.<page>I have taught you all I can. Go back into the world, traveller, and leave me to my solitude.
Brother Mato, in your lonely home at the top of the world... do you still think of me as an enemy?<page>In the future, if you will listen... I will tell you why I chose to tread this path.

That Nail Art you've learnt, the Cyclone Slash. That was always Mato's favourite.<page>It must have made him ecstatic to have a pupil like you. He always wanted to pass down what he'd learnt to a new generation.<page>He was not the most skilled pupil himself, but his enthusiasm and his kindness set him apart. I'm glad he achieved what he desired for so long. To be a teacher...

I see you've been taught a Nail Art by my brother Sheo. How fortunate of you.<page>Yes, he was the mightiest of the Great Nailsage's pupils, far outshining Mato and myself. My brother and my master loved him very much.<page>He was always aloof, but... not unkind. When we last spoke, he said he was going to teach himself something completely new. I wonder if he achieved that goal.
Ah, I can see it in your eyes - you're ready to learn my Nail Art! Shall we begin the lesson immediately?

Ah! So my brother Sheo has taught you his Nail Art, the Great Slash! How lucky you are to have trained with him!<page>Sheo and I were very close when we trained together under the Great Nailsage. He often spoke of becoming tired of the Nail Arts and wanting to try something new.<page>I'm glad to see he changed his mind and continues to bear the proud title of Nailmaster along with me!
You honour me beyond words, my pupil...<page>Thank you.
My pupil, you have come to visit your old master! This is an honour I scarcely deserve.<page>Please, sit. You are always welcome to meditate here with me.

My brother, Sheo... how fare you in that green kingdom of thorns you call home? I think of you every time I raise my nail...<page>Do you ever close your eyes and remember the time we spent together with Oro and our master? I like to think you do...

That Nail Art, the Dash Slash... learnt from my brother Oro, was it not?<page>So he is still alive then. Hm. I still haven't forgotten what he owes me and I never will.<page>Oh, I'm sorry. I shouldn't bother you with such things. I'm happy that you were able to train under another Nailmaster and grow stronger, my pupil.

Oh, look who's joined us! We have quite a merry crowd now, don't we?<page>This fellow came wandering in to my hut, quite distraught and on his own quest for a new calling in life.<page>We talked, and found a common love of creating and building and honing a craft. So now we make art together!<page>It's good to have company, I hadn't realised how lonely I was. It's like being with my brothers again! Stay with us, if you like!
So what will it be, traveller? Will you pay the price asked of you, or will you leave this place unenlightened?

That Nail Art... you have been training with my brother Mato.<page>He has strange notions of loyalty and honour. I'm sure he was difficult and unpleasant to train under.<page>Did he mention my name to you? If he does, tell him to be patient. He'll be waiting a while longer before I give him what he wants.

That charm you bear... It seems the Great Nailsage has deemed you skilled enough in the Nail Arts to earn his highest esteem.<page>I do not begrudge you his love. You have earned it.<page>And perhaps by helping you along your path, I have redeemed myself... if only a little.

Hmph. How did you find me, down here where the world ends?<page>Yes, I know why you're here. You came to learn a Nail Art from the legendary Nailmaster Oro.<page>It is the law of the Great Nailsage that I must pass down my teachings to those who are worthy.<page>But no law forbids me from exacting a payment for my time. If you truly wish to train under me, prove it with Geo!

My brother, Oro... what drove you to hide away deep down at the very edge of that ash swept grave?<page>Was it pride, or fear, or shame? Perhaps you should lay down your nail if it haunts you so, and find a new calling that eases your soul.
Something about your bearing... I feel as though you haven't yet abandoned the way of the nail. I can teach you something, if you like...

Hm? Ah, well met! Yes, I thought I could sense the aura of a fierce warrior approaching.<page>I'm impressed you found my sanctuary here at the top of the world. No doubt you've endured many trials and overcome many foes in your quest to find me.<page>No, don't speak a word. I, Nailmaster Mato, who was taught the Art of the Nail by the Great Nailsage himself, hereby accept you as my pupil! Let us begin the lesson immediately!
Oh? Have you, too, grown weary of the weight of a nail? I understand. Stay, if you like, and we can make art together.

A visitor! Why have you crept in here, little grub? Perhaps, like me, you have a taste for discovering new things?<page>I am Sheo, and in a previous life I was a Nailmaster. Yes, the only thing that drove me was becoming stronger and honing my skills with a nail.<page>I imagined it was my one calling in life, but that feeling faded over time. Now I seek a new calling, something that speaks to my soul and compels me forward.<page>That's why I spend my time here, secluded, trying to master the art of creation. Painting, sculpting... these things bring a different kind of pleasure.<page>Mmm. You don't seem very moved by what I've said. Was it Sheo the Nailmaster you were looking for? Did you come to learn a Nail Art? I'll teach you if you insist...

Your form... exquisite! Now I know how my own master felt when he passed down his teachings to us.<page>I hope you don't think me too forward when I say that I consider you to be my child. Yes! When I saw you perform my Nail Art I felt a bond between us suddenly flash into existence!<page>You honour me beyond words, my pupil...<page>Thank you.

So you met my brother Oro and convinced him to teach you his Nail Art. Hmm.<page>It's been a long time since I've seen him. I wonder how much he's changed. He always seemed to be haunted by something, though I never learned what.<page>No matter the distance between us though, we are still brothers. I hope that passing down his learnings to you brought him some happiness.

So! My work, does it move you?<page>The wielding of a nail, the wielding of a brush... these things are not so different.<page>We cut into the world so that we can peer deeper inside.<page>For now though, I have nothing more to teach you. Your path forwards... only you can see it. Good luck.
Have you brought me another nail to be honed? Leave it on the ground and return later, if you're still breathing.
You're not interested, then? Suit yourself.
....An age spent toiling alone... this is much nicer...

We're building a full suite of the Kingdom's Knights. In their time, I barely ever paid them attention, but Sheo keenly remembers each.<page>It's so refreshing. Nothing like the crude practice of Nailwork. I just love all the intricate details.
If you'd like, I can reforge your nail. It'll make the blade far more deadly.
Here we are. The reforging is complete.<page>I've modified the nail to spiral form. A very tricky task it was. You'll find it stronger than ever before.<page>Off you go now. Cut your way forward.
Hmm? Oh, you've returned.
There we go. The reforging is complete.<page>I've honed your nail's edge. You'll find it much stronger than it used to be.<page>Head out there and test its strength against your foes.
In all the dark of Hallownest, who'd have thought I'd meet such an inspiring soul.

It's done. The reforging is done.<page>Your nail is much stronger than it used to be. As strong as it could ever be.<page>In only your weapon have I seen such potential. Finally, I behold the majesty of a Pure Nail. <page>To think this moment has come upon me so soon...<page>...I... I must step outside a moment...

There we go. The reforging is complete.<page>I've added a channel to your nail. It should cut much more efficiently. You'll find it stronger than it used to be.<page>Head out there and test its blade against your foes.
Hmm? You're still here. Is there something else you want?
As you wish. I'll get to work then.
Do not hesitate. I beg you. Cut me down! I want to taste that blade's exquisite edge.

Hmm? Oh, hello traveller. How strange that we should meet again in a world as vast as this.<page>I must thank you for not killing me when I asked you to. I was irritated at first, but I had some time to think up there and I soon saw the wisdom in your decision.<page>The world is made of more than metal and weapons. I set out exploring, and soon found my way here.<page>Sheo is a master of many arts, and has promised to teach me what he can. I think I'll be quite happy here.
Unused
This is fabulous. I'd never have believed my claws capable of such deft construction.
If you bring me a piece of Pale Ore, I can forge it into your nail and make it stronger still.
If you bring me three pieces of Pale Ore, I can forge it into your nail and make it stronger still.
If you bring me two pieces of Pale Ore, I can forge it into your nail and make it stronger still.

With a Pure Nail forged, my work in this lifetime comes to an end. My only remaining desire is to see and feel the nail strike true!<page>I beg you, cut me down. As my final moment in life, I want to taste the blade's exquisite edge.<page>After all this time, all this toil... haven't I earned it?
Ah, you don't have the Geo? Come and see me when you do.

After a Nailsmith are you? Well you've found one. I'm not much for talk, but if its a nail that needs repair then you've come to the right bug.<page>Your own nail is in quite a sorry state. It's obviously not one of mine. Still, anything can be refined with enough effort and skill, even that broken blade.
I see you have some Pale Ore. A rare, fine metal, that. Give me the ore and some Geo for my efforts, and I'll reforge your nail to make it stronger.
I'm afraid I can't speak at length. If I move too much, Sheo's masterwork will be ruined and I'd hate to see him upset.<page>Though he may seem imposing, in truth he's a delicate sort.
My life's work achieved... What more is left...?
Hmm?<page>Oh. I thought you were someone else.
...To forge the perfect Nail...

Hallownest's heart... Magnificent even in mourning.

Oh, hello there! Seems we both tread far from the path.<page>I can hardly believe those dusty old highways led to such a lush and lively place!<page>This building suggests some form of worship, though its idol has clearly been long forgotten. Doubles equally well for a moment's respite.

Can you imagine this place in its time? Hordes of bugs travelling about the Kingdom; stag bells ringing; the station bustling with activity and life.<page>Now only our like even know it exists.<page>That's a special thing I suppose, to cherish these sights, even in their decay.
Your nail looks a fine instrument, but it's showing signs of wear.<page>I'd wager up there it would take you far. Down here however, I suspect you'll soon meet dangers the surface world can't match.
What is this feeling?... So familiar. Drawn forward yet repelled.<page>And those shapes upon the door...To gaze directly at them turns my mind to fog.
Do not hesitate. The choice to reform was hers, not mine.<page>She knows what you would do and seems to welcome it.
Even those great stags bowed to Hallownest's King. What devotion he must have inspired.
Unused
Unused

For so long I've felt drawn here. So many tales full of wonders and horrors. No longer could I resist. I just had to see it for myself.<page>And what a time I chose to arrive! This dead world has sprung to life.<page>The creatures are riled up and the earth rumbles. The air is thick. I wonder what could have brought it all about?

Hello again! I suppose you've already met with the tribe of this village, hmm? They seem a little distrustful of strangers... to put it lightly.<page>They're not brutes though, no. The sickness in the air that clouds the mind of lesser beasts... they resist it. They retain their intellect and their honour, though also their lethal traditions.<page>I've some words of advice, my friend. If you plan to challenge the lords of this tribe, your blunted nail may prove inadequate.<page>There is a city nearby, the old capital of Hallownest. I've heard a Nailsmith resides there. Seek the old bug out and you may find progress that much easier.
Did you pass that town above? What a gloomy little place. And such majesty hidden right beneath!<page>I suppose that's why they've all headed down here. Who could resist such possibilities?

Did she call you too then? I realise it's no coincidence we arrive together. <page>Though much of my memory is blank, this place I recall.<page>Within these chambers the Teacher sought to store the Kingdom's knowledge and at its core, she stored herself.
That lake... a revered presence once slept deep within...<page>Did it? What would make me think such things?
I saw a strange fellow out there. He seemed quite taken by the lake.<page>I'd planned to offer greetings, though figured I'd first tend to my nail on chance our meeting goes poorly.
This one too must seek the village at the nest's heart. What mystery the purpose that sees it share my path.
...Who are you, that leads me to this place?
Hello there! How delightful to meet another traveller on these forgotten roads.<page>You're a short one, but you've a strong look about you.

Hello, hello! What a thrill this is, to find such warm comfort amidst the den of beasts.<page>This is a ferocious place no doubt. Supposedly, there's a village deep in the warren. Its inhabitants never accepted Hallownest's King.

Isn't this something. I'd not expected to discover so huge a Stag Station after that foggy descent.<page>The bugs of Hallownest must've been an impressive lot, building such grand structures so far into these wilds.<page>Seems the dangerous creatures about haven't yet made their way in here. It's the perfect place for a quick rest.

Ahh, but her mind is still locked to you. That final, powerful protection stays in place.<page>If you would attempt to break her seal, you've first to discover the means to open a mind. Such tools may exist to perform the feat, though in my own travels I've not come across one.<page>I'd heard it told the Kingdom's moths did delve amongst dreams and the dead. Perhaps you'd seek them out?
Hallownest is perfect for vigilant explorers like us. So tense and thrilling. In this place, you're either alert or you're dead.
She called me here, now, to reverse that protection. All in aid of you.
To save Hallownest, the Teacher willingly became a seal, but upon herself she enacted an additional protection.<page>Though I cannot recall its happening, I played a part in that feat.
Isn't this a wonderful spot for a rest? I so love the sound of the rain upon glass.
Truly a marvel...

The capital lies before us my friend. What a sombre place it seems and one that holds the answers to many a mystery.<page>I too have felt the pull of this place, though now I sit before it I find myself hesitant to descend.<page>Is it fear I wonder, or something else that holds me back?

The city looks to be built into an enormous cavern, and the rain pours down from cracks in the stone above.<page>There must be a lot of water up there somewhere. I suppose, if the cave roof stayed strong this long, it should hold for us.<page>Before I leave this Kingdom, I'd like to see where all that water comes from. What a sight it must be!

If you look down from here, through the rain, you can just make out those twisted sentries, their husks still stuck in endless patrol.<page>I'd be cautious around them my short friend. Their training will not have been forgotten. This city presents some formidable foes.
I can feel it calling... Dare I head in?

Doesn't this kingdom just abound with surprises? A building atop an acid lake.<page>Despite the sight, I can't help but feel... familiarity? Something stirs in my mind, though I can't yet tell what..<page>I'd thought it my lust for discovery that led me here but now there seems something else.<page>This building beckons me.

To persevere in this ruin, that old nail alone just won't be enough. Though that's no problem! One only has to look around.<page>Plenty have come before us and most have met their grisly end, many more equipped than you and I.<page>I'm sure they wouldn't mind were a fellow explorer to relieve them of their tools. It's a kindness really. The dead shouldn't be burdened with such things.
So small it seems...
My own route takes me towards that great city. If you search out the Nailsmith, it may not be long until our paths cross again.

Ahh, quite a view, no?<page>I'm not surprised you survived the trek through these shimmering caverns.<page>There's an air of strength about you. I suspect it would be quite intimidating, if not for your small stature.

Did it sadden you to see those miners below, still labouring at their endless task?<page>Even overcome, strong purpose has been imprinted upon their husks.<page>The crystal ore is said to contain a sort of energy, not as powerful as the soul the city dwellers harnessed but far less lethal.<page>...Strange to know such ancient facts. I wonder from where my knowledge comes?
At this high vantage I can just make it out, the light from that sad little town.<page>I doubt its residents could even comprehend the scale of the world that surrounds them.
To think, such a small creature would bear this kingdom's fate.

The Madam's life is extinguished and with it her seal breaks.<page>It's a heavy thing you attempt, but I've seen your prowess up close and she too believed you capable.<page>Be on your journey then, and allow me rest a time. With the deed complete, I begin to feel my age.

A great stone egg, lying in the corpse of an ancient kingdom. And this egg...Is it warm? It certainly gives off a unique air.<page>Can it be opened? There are strange marks all over it...<page>I do so love a mystery...And who knows what other marvels lie even deeper below us...
I'm Quirrel. I have something of an obsession with uncharted places.<page>This ancient kingdom holds many fascinating mysteries, and one of the most intriguing of them is standing right before us.
...Who was it that told me of the Nailsmith? I can't even remember, yet I can almost picture the smith himself...
...Incredible...
To live an age, yet remember so little... Perhaps I should be thankful?<page>All tragedy erased. I see only wonders...
...These winds cry lonely. Better the comfort of rock above one's head.
Why not join me for a time? These waters do wonders for weary legs.
Why do you hesitate? Mercy is a fine thing, but you and her agree this must be done. Be brave, friend.
Is it that, just faintly, you can still hear the echo of the bells?

Again we meet, my short friend. Here at last, I feel at peace.<page>Twice I've seen this world and though my service may have stripped the first experience from me, I'm thankful I could witness its beauty again.<page>Hallownest is a vast and wondrous thing, but with as many wonders as it holds, I've seen none quite so intriguing as you.<page>Ha. My flattery returns only silent stoicism. I like that.<page>I like that very much.

A third Arcane Egg? You're an exceptional explorer to have found so many.<page>An egg is a perfect protective form. In Hallownest we use stone journals or tablets, our text engraved atop. These eggs are far more secure. Their records are stored within.<page>In fear of damaging the eggs, I'm only able to access the outer layer, but it's clear those in the distant past could somehow access information stored even deeper within.<page>If only I could find a way to do so. Just think of the discoveries to be made!
Gone out to clear my head. Will be back soon. If you have something you absolutely must sell, come find me in Fountain Square.

An Arcane Egg, eh? Now this, this is an ancient thing. These relics are the prize of my profession. There's knowledge hidden within, though it's very difficult, painstaking work to extract.<page>One large understanding can be gleaned though. This civilisation may claim itself the first, but something else did exist within this place before Hallownest.<page>Each egg offers a narrow glimpse into that forgotten age.
Hm. Looks like you don't have any relics on you. If you manage to find any in good condition, bring them to me and I'll give you a fair amount of Geo for them.

Yep, that's another Hallownest Seal alright.<page>The shop'll be overflowing with these things soon. Gah! I'd never guessed so many would still be lying around.<page>If they're as common as you make them seem, maybe I've been offering too much for them?

A Wanderer's Journal, eh?<page>Though they're common finds about the kingdom, I much enjoy the deciphering of their text.<page>Read together they paint a morbid tale. It seems fate was unkind to most who travel within Hallownest's ruin.
A Hallownest Seal?<page>You're a talented collector, alright. The best I've met. If you keep at it, I worry I'll run out of space in the shop!

A King's Idol?<page>If you look closely, each of these idols is subtly different. There are fine engravings about them that take some time to decipher.<page>I suspect each was tailored to the owner. A personalised symbol of the king's omnipotence.
I'll be getting back to the shop soon. If I stay out here too long I'll get washed into the Waterways.<page>Come and visit if you like. If you have relics, I mean. I'm not much for chatter.

A King's Idol?<page>With as many of these as you've delivered, the other Relic Seekers are like to think I've gone mad for the King!<page>Pah! Who am I kidding. They'll only be jealous of my collection. Find me more!

A King's Idol?<page>I've often wondered the true visage of the king. Depictions are of an imposing, gleaming figure and a fiercely horned crown.<page>I suspect there's much embellishment in the imagery though. A ruler seeking worship tends to hide their blemishes. It'd do no good to appear a common bug.

A Wanderer's Journal? Yes. Yes. I'll add it to the pile with the others.<page>I don't know when I'll get to decipher this one. It's long hard work translating the many languages of the bugs that explore these caverns.
Another Wanderer's Journal?<page>I might not offer a lot for each but they're plentiful about the caverns and I doubt you'll find another willing to make trade for Geo.

Another Wanderer's Journal, eh?<page>This journal is of traditional stone type. Text endures well upon it.<page>In its declining age, this city switched from stone to parchment woven of spider's silk.<page>It's a small tragedy, but the moisture in these towers has rendered most of those texts illegible.
A Wanderer's Journal?<page>You've a knack for finding these. Corpses must be frequent on your journey. No doubt your nail's created many more.
What's that? A Wanderer's Journal?<page>I've so many of these now. Once I get around to deciphering them all, I'll be the preeminent scholar on Hallownest's dead.

A Wanderer's Journal?Have you heard that saying about stone journals?If danger lurks close by and your nail has dulled with wear,
Just swing your journal at your foes with blunt and deadly flair.S'a good one isn't it! And accurate. They sure have a heft to them.
A Wanderer's Journal?<page>It's quite incredible how many of these you've collected. You must have travelled the breadth of the kingdom to accrue such a haul.

A King's Idol, eh?<page>Hallownest's king was an elusive figure, deified by the citizens. With the king rarely seen, worship was offered through these idols.<page>There's an expert craft to them. Few alive could match this skill.

A Hallownest Seal, eh? Very interesting this.<page>Do you know of the Kingdom's five great knights? They're revered figures of Hallownest, often mentioned in the annals of the Kingdom, but only as a group.<page>Both their names and appearance seem to have been expunged from history.<page>So long has passed since their time. It'd be a grand achievement to discover their identities.

Another King's Idol?<page>Have you visited the remnants of his palace? It's down below this city, in the bedrock of the kingdom.<page>Must've been an impressive sight in its time. Now there's nothing left.<page>It's a strange thing though. There are no signs of conflict around the area. It's as though the whole place just vanished.
...Who were you mystery knight?... Why no mention beyond your fountain?..
Another Hallownest Seal? Pass it over then.

There's a forgotten history hidden in this kingdom's antiques, though few seem willing to look. Others come just to claw away at the cracks and ruins.<page>Pah! Scavengers and thieves. It's contemptible.
We've talked enough I think. Relics need cleaning. Texts need deciphering. Out with you! This isn't a museum.

Admiring my shop are you? Well I'm no squatter.<page>This place was dead empty when I moved in and there's no one left alive who'd lay claim to the tower.<page>If you fancy yourself a domicile in the city, go find somewhere else, preferably in another building.<page>I'm well content with just my relics. I'm not after neighbours.

Another Hallownest Seal?<page>Others have told me there's a statue out by the city's entrance depicting a large knightly figure. Could be one of the Kingdom's great five.<page>I'd have looked it over myself, but the gate's long been shut tight and it's too much hassle taking the long way round with all those blasted husks about.

Oh? What are you doing out in this miserable downpour?<page>Impressive fountain isn't it? I'm sure we'd be able to appreciate it more if we weren't both getting drenched.<page>That knight up there was an important one. The plaque here mentions its 'sacrifice,' which carries something of an ominous tone.<page>Probably met some sort of horrible end, though it sounds like the knight's goal may have been achieved in the process<page>In all the relics I've collected, I've yet to find a clue as to what that was.

Another Hallownest Seal? Pass it over.<page>Ah. I enjoy collecting their like, but there's little information to be gleaned of each.<page>Mind you, they do keep a nice shine about them and there's nothing wrong with appreciating something purely on aesthetic merits.

That nail you bear looks mighty blunt. There're cracks all through it. It's as much a relic as the objects in my shop!<page>I've little interest in weapons myself, but it may be an idea to hunt down that old Nailsmith.<page>His hut's on the outskirts of the city. Not that far from here. He might help add some sting to your weapon, provided he's feeling generous.
A Hallownest Seal, eh? Give it here.<page>Do you have anything else for me? If not, get your damp little self out of my home.

Urgh! What do you think you're doing, coming into my nice little shop stinking like that?!<page>These relics have been through enough. They don't need you spreading your stench all over them! Crawl back to the Waterways or wherever you came from!
...This short one's got an odd look about it... though vaguely familiar?..

Aye Aye. Come searching for rare items have you? Well hands off! This collection is mine and I won't be selling to grubby little wanderers.<page>Still, I imagine you come across many interesting items in your travels. Maybe you'd care to part with some? I'll offer a fair trade for each.

No touching the antiques! My stock is not for sale.<page>Still, if you've managed to come upon any interesting trinkets during your travels, I may be willing to trade. Step over to the counter here and I'll see what you've got.
Not carrying any relics with you? Go find some for me. I'll pay good Geo for nice items.

A fourth Arcane Egg! I wouldn't have believed it possible. I've never met a bug with your knack for uncovering this Kingdom's treasures.<page>You must have some sort of sense about you? Or maybe these eggs are somehow drawn to you.<page>My fellows have claimed there's a will of sorts within each egg, that each seeks its own bearer, or reject them.<page>That'd be a subtle power indeed, and I remain sceptical. Relic Seekers are prone to confusing facts with fable.

Another Arcane Egg?<page>It's a rare chance to own two of these. I'll be the envy of all my colleagues, though my purse is feeling much lighter for it.<page>These eggs are the most desired find from time before Hallownest, but they're not the only remnant of that age.<page>You may have come upon them, those old statues that seem a store for soul? They too prove its existence, though in a larger, cruder form.

Ah ho! I'm sensing new power about you, one that'll crack the rock beneath us. A useful thing for one looking to travel ever deeper.<page>My third uncle used to possess similar abilities. He also possessed a ferocious temper! Ohohoho! What a dreadful combination.
And look! The gate between us has opened. Ohoho!<page>I'm sure you're eager to move on. Farewell, and have faith! Whatever you are seeking... it will find you! Ohohoho!
Why do you hesitate? You'll get nothing more from me, I'm afraid.<page>Though I do admire your persistence! Ohohohoho!
Don't be afraid. Have faith! That spell belongs to you now, all you need to do is take it!<page>Ohohoho, you won't be going much further without it, I promise you!

Oho! Who is that creeping out of the darkness? My, you're looking grim! A strange, empty face and a wicked looking weapon!<page>Something important has drawn you down into Hallownest's corpse, but I won't ask what. Perhaps the reason you've found me is because you need my help?<page>Say no more, friend. I'm going to give you a gift, a nasty little spell of my own creation. It's just perfect for a little one like you! Ohoho!
Poking around in the dreams of others... You're more curious than you look! Oho ho ho ho!
Oho! What brings you back through here, little shadow? Are you lost?<page>Don't worry about me. I don't need anything more from you. Ohohoho!

Oho! There you are! I was watching over you while you slept, and must have slipped away myself. I woke up and found you'd disappeared! You are a surprising one, ohoho!<page>Actually, I wanted to ask a small favour of you. You see, there is a certain creature lurking just above us, in the heart of this temple...<page>...Oho? Well, yet another surprise! You've slain that creature before I've even asked!<page>I scarcely deserve such a friend as you! You're a marvel! Ohohoho!

Oho! So it's done then, you've slain the beast!<page>The poor thing! It must have been terrified of you. It used to be quite docile, but the rancid air in these caverns filled it with some ancient rage.<page>Still, you did what had to be done! You have my gratitude! Of course, we both know you wouldn't have made it through without that spell of mine... Ohoho!
...Hear...me...

My friend. My friend. There's another quality about you yet. You didn't perchance visit my fourth aunt?<page>She makes her home beside that Crystal Mount. Leaves quite an impression on those that seek her out. Were I not bound here, I'd love to visit myself.
That scream? Ooohh, distorted in such a way... It's not within the skills of us snails to do such a thing.<page>Wherever you draw this new power from, it's not a place my kind ever thought to look.
...Free...me...
Oho, you've come back! Didn't you like the look of my gift? You left without saying a word!<page>Perhaps you're braver than you think! Go ahead and take what belongs to you!

What's this? My vengeful gift has warped within you. You've twisted it into something... else.<page>Ohohohoh! I knew it. My friend! You're a marvel. Your essence has melded with the spell.<page>You must have found a powerful source to transform it in such a unique, expressive way.
A corpse overgrown with vegetation.

Oho? You've woken at last! I apologise, perhaps I should have warned you about the power of that spell. I was watching over you as you slept, but seem to have slipped away myself! Ohohoho!<page>Now we're awake, I was wondering whether you would do me a small favour. Not as repayment for my gift of course, simply because we're now friends.<page>You see, a horrid great beast has made its home in the heart of this temple. Such disrespect! I would be quite grateful if you were to venture deeper in and slay it for me.<page>It's a hardy creature, but with your new power you're more than a match for it! Good luck with this small favour, my friend! Ohohohohohoho!

What is it? Are you wondering about this gate between us? Ohoho! It's a curious thing, but this door will not open until you have slain that creature lying in the heart of the temple.<page>Don't worry about it. I'm sure the spirits of my ancestors will be watching over you.

Pried a spell out've my larger cousin did you? Aren't you the charming one.<page>She's not usually the generous sort, certainly not as giving as myself, but she does have that wonderful voice! It's no surprise her spells take on such aural force.
Pockets feeling empty? If you need some more Geo, take a trip into the ruins below us and hunt around. Just take care not to fall into a haze. I won't be coming down to rescue you.

How are your travels, Nailmaster? As time goes by, I'm sure you'll only grow stronger.<page>If you see your fellow Nailmasters again, tell them I carry them in my thoughts always. And that they should come and buy something from their old teacher as a mark of respect.

You've found a new nail, then? It looks like a much finer weapon than the last.<page>Hmm? Oh, this is the same nail... but it's been honed! By someone extremely skilled...<page>A nail is an extension of ourselves, it is the instrument by which we shape the world around us. It's a sacred duty to keep its edges sharp.<page>...Heh, sorry. I shouldn't ramble on like that. Let's talk Geo instead.

I see they've opened that mapping shop across the way. I suppose a little competition is healthy.<page>Perhaps I should start to sell maps as well... or is that a little aggressive? Heh. All's fair in a world made of Geo.
...Wherever you are... Whatever it is you do now... I hope you three are looking after yourselves...
...So, another would join our group.
Back again? You know I haven't any stock left, yes? You've cleaned me out.<page>Or were you hoping to sneak a peek at my mountain of Geo? Well it's mine now! And fairly traded.

You're exploring then? Very brave! Plenty of courageous wanderers have been lost to the hunger of these old caverns.<page>You have your nail though, and I can tell just by looking that you know how to wield it.
...ugghh, Oro you oaf.... You wield your nail... like a club...<page>...Esmy... how much deeper do we have to go...

Hmm, you seem a little different. Something has changed in your bearing.<page>Ah! The way you hold your nail! So you've learnt a Nail Art...<page>Very interesting. I wonder, do you have the passion to continue your training?
...These refined weapons...The battles of Geo are much deadlier...

Ah, hello! I knew we'd meet again. How do you like my cosy little store? I've made myself pretty comfortable here, selling old trinkets to travellers like yourself.<page>If you're planning a trip below, I've several items that may improve your chance of survival.

I have a gift for you, warrior. As a shopkeeper, I admit parting with it for free is rather difficult.<page>But as the Great Nailsage I must recognise your skill. You have mastered the arts of my remaining pupils. Now tradition decrees you too may hold the symbol.

I'm Sly. Usually, I live an uneventful life up in Dirtmouth. The air in these ruins doesn't agree with me, so I'd best be getting back.<page>If you return above, come and see me. I'm probably the friendliest face left there, and I can thank you properly for your good deed.
Oh! What?! Who are you?!<page>...I see. This old village. What a strange dream, to have led me down here! If you hadn't found me, I don't think I would've ever woken.
...Geo. Geo. All the world is Geo. No nail can withstand its might...

What do you have there? Why, that's the key to my storeroom! I thought I'd lost it for good.<page>Hmm? Did you find it in those old mines perhaps? Very curious. I've no idea how it ended up in such a remote place.<page>Very honest of you to return it to me, yes. Very kind. And now that I can open my old storeroom up, I can sell you some of the rare stock that's been gathering dust in there.<page>These items may be a little time-worn, but they still retain their full market value. Very precious stuff! Take a look...

What do you have there? Why, that's the key to my storeroom! I thought I'd lost it for good.<page>Hmm? Did you find it in those old mines perhaps? Very curious. I've no idea how it ended up in such a remote place.<page>Very honest of you to return it to me, yes. Very kind. And now that I can open my old storeroom up, I can sell you some of the rare stock that's been gathering dust in there.<page>These items may be a little time-worn, but they still retain their full market value. Very precious stuff! Take a look...
Off you go Nailmaster. I've nothing more to give you...<page>Nothing for free at least. I'll be up briefly and eager take your Geo in trade for my precious wares.

Ah, still looking for something to buy? Is your Geo weighing you down? Unfortunately, you seem to have cleared out everything I'd be willing to part with. Nothing left at all!<page>I think there might be a few old trinkets down in my storeroom, but I lost the key a while ago.<page>So, no more business between us I'm afraid! For now at least. Get out of here and let me spend some quality time with all the Geo you've gifted me.
Wear it proudly, Nailmaster. You shall be the last to receive its like.

It was a long time ago, but I remember when these highways and crossroads pulsed with life. These are the paths I first carried passengers through when I was young.<page>Those travellers are long gone, yet still I remain. Now it seems it's just you and I and the furtive creatures scratching and squirming all around us.

Before you rang the bell, I'd almost forgotten this station existed. It was not often used by the common bugs, being a well-guarded retreat for our late Queen.<page>Even as overgrown as they've become, these gardens are still beautiful after all this time. I'm sure the Queen would be happy to know that.
Ahh, little one... Where are we? I have never been to this station. It has a strange air of danger to it. Let me take you somewhere safer, quickly.
I tire so easily now, and my old legs seem to ache more and more. Still, I'm lucky to grow old at all... so many others haven't.

That flower you're carrying... It looks quite beautiful, but also very delicate. I fear if you travel with me it will be ruined.<page>If you need to keep it intact, I'd suggest using your own legs to carry it to its destination.

I see another takes rest upon the bench. There's something unpleasant about that one, but a stag station's doors are open to all.<page>If he requests passage, I'll offer it gladly. My duty as a stag far outweighs any personal distaste.
Being back in my old home... I feel the weight of my long life bearing down on me.<page>I carry it proudly, though. Wherever I travel, the memories of my family and my kind come with me.

This place... we are near the surface, I believe? There is a town here. You should take the opportunity to rest.<page>This place was once full of travellers coming and going. It seems much quieter now.

That pass you hold! Is it not for that ghastly machine, the tram? I hope you're not thinking of riding on that grotesque contraption.<page>The thought a mere machine could attempt what we stags do! Foolish...Very foolish.

What do you think of my old home, little one?<page>It was full of life, once. Stags coming and going, swapping stories of the places they'd been and the passengers they'd met.<page>For a long time now, I've considered myself the only one remaining. The last stag.<page>But being in the Nest again... there's something in the air. A smell, or a warmth, or a presence perhaps?<page>Could it be, other stags have made their way out into the wider world?

Little one! I've found it! The Stag Nest, where I was born and raised.<page>I've yet to go there again. My duty binds me to travel only where I am called, but if you wished to see it yourself, I could take you there.<page>None may remain to welcome us, but the nest is still a sight to behold! Give me the word, and we will go there at once.

Ahh, many stag stations have been opened. Again I can travel the breadth of the kingdom. So many grand thoroughfares and old sideways I'd forgotten.<page>Somewhere amongst the lines lies the Stag Nest, the place where I was born and raised. I'd thought its location lost to my failing mind, but now I can almost remember the path.<page>If you keep opening stag stations and beckoning me through them, perhaps I'll again find that Nest. Ahh, I would like that very much!

Yes, I will hold onto that hope. My kin, still alive, still out there, journeying beyond these lands.<page>But for me, I could never abandon the stagways. Not as long as passengers still need them.<page>I can tell you still have important work to do. I will be your companion as long as my old body still serves.<page>Let us enjoy the old stagways of this kingdom together a little longer.

Little one, we stand in the King's Station! Named of course for the King of Hallownest, he who ordered the building of the stagways and stations.<page>The King never rode the stagways himself, but I've heard he was a glorious bug to behold, bright and radiant in visage, so much so it hurt to look at him.
Ready to go, little one?
Eager to travel the stagways? Just hop upon that platform, give me the signal and we'll soon be on our way.

Ah! What station is this, hidden all the way at the bottom of the world?<page>Until I heard the bell calling, I didn't even know the Stagways travelled so deep. You've discovered something quite astounding, little one!<page>No matter how old I grow, the world still keeps surprises like this stowed away...

Greetings, little one! It's been an age since I last heard the ringing of a station bell. It echoed down the stagways and called me to you.<page>I've grown stiff and tired over these many years and I've forgotten much, but the sound of the bell will always call me back.<page>These stagways stretch the depths of Hallownest. If you want to travel them, hail me from the platform. I will take you where you need to go.
The Resting Grounds... Passengers would come here to conduct rituals for those who had passed on.<page>Not any more though. Perhaps the dead conduct their own rituals now?

You've opened several stag stations now, haven't you? I'm thankful for the opportunity to once more travel through the kingdom.<page>As I visit more places I feel my memories returning to me, like the stagways of my mind are running once more.<page>Continue to open the stations and you'll have my deepest gratitude.
An empty eggshell.

Ahh, this gladdens me. The Queen's Station has opened once more. This place was a bustling hub of travel, well-placed for travellers visiting the outer edges of the land.<page>You're quite the explorer to find this place.
I remember this station well. A common trip it was. Goods from all over the kingdom were transported here.<page>Not a lot was sent back the other way though.
My, this place is much changed since I last saw it. The greenery grows so wild the station's like to be consumed by it.
